Buffalo.Kaleida Health:
Kaleida Health, founded in 1998, is a not-for-profit healthcare network that manages five hospitals in the Buffalo–Niagara Falls metropolitan area.


== Facilities ==
It runs the Buffalo General Medical Center, a hospital on the premises of the Buffalo Niagara Medical Campus. It was founded on its current site in the 19th century and has underwent expansions ever since, including one in the 1986 that added a 16-story tower to the main complex.
